definition: to hold an inconsequential job/to receive a cold reception/to be kept waiting for an assignment or audience/to be out in the cold/to be sidelined/to warm the bench/to cool one's heels
surname Zuo
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
surname Leng
cold
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
see 老闆|老板, boss
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious
bench/stool
variant of 凳[deng4]

sentences.english: Miller was riding the bench in Saturday's game.
sentences.chinese: 星期六的比赛米勒在坐冷板凳。

sentences.english: Because of his bad performance, he became a bench warmer for the rest of the basketball season.
sentences.chinese: 因为他表现不好，剩下的季赛他就只好坐冷板凳。

sentences.english: The director of the play benched the lead actress because she was always late for rehearsals.
sentences.chinese: 剧的导演让女主角坐冷板凳，因为排练时她总迟到。

sentences.english: He was benched during the basketball game because of his bad performance last season.
sentences.chinese: 由于上个赛季表现不好，他现在在坐冷板凳。

sentences.english: Investors give South Africa cold shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 投资者们让南非坐冷板凳。

sentences.english: Two more of last season 's title-winners will find themselves warming the bench.
sentences.chinese: 另有两个上赛季的冠军获得者将会坐冷板凳。

sentences.english: Winger Pasquale Foggia has had an inconsistent year, often finding himself on the substitutes' bench.
sentences.chinese: 对于边锋福贾来说这一年不太顺，经常坐冷板凳。

definition: to endure (years of suffering)
to put in an important position
to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment
live in Cao camp but have the heart in Han camp (idiom)/to be somewhere while longing to be somewhere else
pinyin: shen1 zai4 Cao2 ying2 xin1 zai4 Han4

definition: soured by the loss of one's hopes
to receive a scolding

marginalized people (not part of mainstream society)/marginal man (term coined by social psychologist Kurt Lewin, referring to a person in transition between two cultures or social groups, not fully belonging to either)
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
weak and inept person/hopeless case
pinyin: fu2 bu4 qi3 de5 A1 dou3

definition: to be willing to/to be ready to/to be content with/accepting (of restriction, sacrifice, risk etc)
to idle/to waste time
to snub/to consign to the trash heap of history
to get off one's high horse (idiom)/to dispense with posturing (and adopt a more humble or empathetic attitude)
to improve one's family's social status by moving up in the world/to switch one's allegiance to a new patron
to break clear of all the troubles and hardships/to achieve success/to make it
